alert.note: Alert for Fillmore (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 18 at 10:11PM CDT until April 18 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CDT FOR YORK AND NORTH CENTRAL FILLMORE COUNTIES... At 1011 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Bradshaw to near McCool Junction to near Fairmont, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... York around 1020 PM CDT. Waco and Benedict around 1030 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Thayer. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 343 and 365. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
